Base.question: 1. Has the founder/co-founder had a successful exit via M&A or IPO?
options: Yes
No

Base.question: 2. Is the founder/co-founder a successful CEO with prior achievements in the industry?
options: Yes
No

Experience.question: What prior work experience does the founder/co-founder have?
options: A. No prior work experience
B. Generic work experience (not relevant to the industry)
C. Experience as a product manager, in sales or technology, or in roles specific to the industry
D. Experience in building a startup with successful product launches / scaling revenue
E. Experience as a C-suite executive (e.g., COO/CTO/CFO) with deep domain expertise

Education.question: What is the highest level of education attained by the founder/co-founder?
options: A. No education
B. General degrees not specific to the industry
C. Degrees relevant to the industry
D. Elite/top tier universities with general degrees not specific to the industry
E. Elite/top tier universities with degrees relevant to the industry

Team.question: Describe the composition of the founding team.
options: A. Solo founder or team covers few functional areas
B. Team of entrepreneurs with complementary skills
C. Team covers most functional areas
D. Complete management team with a well-rounded founding team
E. Co-founders or team members have previously worked together in a startup or company

Market Opportunity.title: 2. Size of the Opportunity / Market Size

Market Size.question: What is the estimated market size for the product/service?
options: A. Market size < USD 100 million
B. Market size USD 100 million to 300 million
C. Market size USD 300 million to 500 million
D. Market size USD 500 million to 1 billion
E. Market size > USD 1 billion

Market Growth Rate.question: What is the growth rate of the market?
options: A. Growth rate 0% to 10%
B. Growth rate 10% to 20%
C.  Growth rate 20% to 30%
D. Growth rate 30% to 40%
E. Growth rate > 40%

Base-2.question: Is the startup generating revenue with strong month-on-month / year-on-year revenue growth?
options: Yes
No

Revenue.question: What is the current revenue status of the startup?
options: A. No revenue generated
B. Some revenue generated, inconsistent growth
C. Some revenue generated, consistent moderate growth
D. Generating revenue but not consistently growing
E. Generating consistent and moderately growing revenue

Strategic Partnerships and Pilot Program.question: Does the startup have any strategic partnerships or pilot programmes?
options: A. No strategic partnerships or pilot programs
B. Some partnerships/pilot programs indicating initial market validation
C. Several partnerships/pilot programs indicating initial market validation
D. Multiple partnerships/pilot programs indicating strong market validation
E. Exclusive partnerships or numerous successful pilot programs

User Engagement / Organic Social Media G.question: What is the level of user engagement or organic social media growth for the startup?
options: A. Low engagement, minimal organic growth on socials
B. Moderate engagement, some organic growth on socials
C. Decent engagement, consistent organic growth on socials
D. High engagement, strong organic growth on socials
E. Very high engagement, key opinion leader on socials

Stage of Development.question: What stage is the product/solution currently in?
options: A. Idea / Research stage
B. Concept testing / Prototype
C. Product development stage
D. Market Testing
E. Commercialization stage

Scalability.question: How scalable is the product/solution?
options: A. Limited scalability, cannot handle growth
B. Some scalability, moderate growth potential
C. Moderately scalable with potential for significant growth
D. Highly scalable, can handle significant growth
E. Highly scalable, designed for extensive growth and additional use cases

Vitamin or Painkiller.question: How essential is the product/solution to the target market?
options: A. Vitamin, nice to have but not essential
B. Somewhat important, addresses some needs but not critical
C. Important, addresses significant needs
D. Very important, addresses critical needs
E. Painkiller, solves a vital problem

Strength of Competitors in the Marketpla.question: How would the competitive landscape be described?
options: A. Dominated by a single large player
B. Dominated by a few large players
C. Competitive, but with opportunities
D. Fragmented, many small players
E. No Competitors

Strength of Competitive Products.question: How would the strength of competitive products be rated?
options: A. Saturated market / red ocean
B. Competitive products are strong
C. Competitive products are average
D. Competitive products are weak
E. No competitive products

Differentiation / Unique Selling Points.question: How differentiated is the product/solution from competitors?
options: A. Limited or no differentiation, easily copied, no Intellectual property
B. Some differentiation, duplication possible
C. Moderately differentiated, some unique aspects
D. Unique and protected by specialized know-how / trade secrets
E. Solid patent protections
